  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Senior Manager",
  "description": "Oracle provides the world&#39;s most complete, open, and integrated business software and hardware systems, with more than 370,000 customers including 100 of the Fortune 100 representing a variety of sizes and industries in more than 145 countries around the globe.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Senior Manager - Consulting Sales&nbsp;

Job Identification:&nbsp;299617
Job Location: Lagos
Job Category: Sales
Role: Individual Contributor
Job Type: Regular Employee

Job Description


	Responsible for sales of Oracle consulting services. We are seeking a high-performing Consulting Sales Representative based in Nigeria to drive sales of Oracle&rsquo;s Banking and Digital Banking Consulting Services across Western Africa, including both Anglophone and select Francophone markets, as well as other assigned accounts in the region.
	This role requires a self-motivated individual with deep knowledge of the financial services industry, strong relationships in the region, and the ability to position Oracle&rsquo;s value proposition to both business and IT stakeholders at the C-level.


Primary Objectives:


	Sell consulting services and meet/exceed sales targets across assigned territories, with emphasis on Kenya, Ethiopia, and other East &amp; Horn of Africa countries.
	Engage strategically with customers to build lasting relationships and lay the foundation for consulting sales.
	Effectively position Oracle&rsquo;s consulting portfolio at C-level, covering business, IT, and operations.
	Build deep client engagement models to drive value and long-term partnerships.
	Create a tailored transformation case, business case, and solution proposals for each client opportunity.
	Manage and close opportunities efficiently through structured sales processes.
	Drive lead generation and pipeline management activities.
	Collaborate across Oracle LOBs, FSBGU teams, and other internal and external stakeholders.
	Lead Oracle FSGU account plans and coverage models to identify and pursue target clients.
	Work with partners, alliances, license sales, and executive-level stakeholders both internally and external ly.&nbsp;


Responsibilities


	Responsible for selling the Oracle consulting services. Develops new accounts and/or expands existing accounts within an established geographic territory, industry, product segment, or channel.


Key Responsibilities:
Sales Ownership &amp; Quota Delivery:


	Own and achieve a personal quota through selling Oracle Consulting Services into assigned territories.
	Develop and execute territory and account-level sales strategies for both white space (new logos) and existing accounts.
	Manage a balanced portfolio of opportunities focused on both transformation-led deals and run-the-bank initiatives.


Customer Engagement:


	Build and nurture senior relationships across banks, regulators, fintechs, and ecosystem partners in West Africa.
	Understand customer needs and position tailored transformation proposals with clear ROI and business impact.
	Deliver strong value propositions and business cases in collaboration with presales, license sales, and delivery teams.


Sales Process &amp; Pipeline Management:


	Create, manage, and progress a healthy pipeline of opportunities aligned with quarterly and annual sales targets.
	Lead customer engagements from opportunity creation through to closure in a structured and collaborative manner.
	Ensure accurate forecasting and deal governance per Oracle&rsquo;s internal processes.


Collaboration &amp; Influence:


	Work in close coordination with Oracle&rsquo;s License Sales, Presales, Product Management, and Consulting Delivery teams.
	Support account planning activities and participate in joint account strategies across lines of business.
	Actively engage Oracle&rsquo;s partner ecosystem to drive strategic collaborations and expand Oracle&rsquo;s market reach.


Qualifications


	Career Level - IC5


The candidate is expected to:


	Hunt and farm across assigned territory and accounts, driving both white-space and existing account opportunities.
	Possess a strong network across the financial services sector.
	Have a proven record of overachieving services sales targets, particularly exceeding USD 10 million annually.
	Be an excellent networker capable of identifying key IT and business stakeholders to position Oracle Consulting services, in alignment with license sales and presales efforts.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Senior Manager - Consulting Sales 

Job Identification: 299617
Job Location: Lagos
Job Category: Sales
Role: Individual Contributor
Job Type: Regular Employee

	This role requires a self-motivated individual with deep knowledge of the financial services industry, strong relationships in the region, and the ability to position Oracle’s value proposition to both business and IT stakeholders at the C-level.


Primary Objectives:


	Sell consulting services and meet/exceed sales targets across assigned territories, with emphasis on Kenya, Ethiopia, and other East & Horn of Africa countries.
	Engage strategically with customers to build lasting relationships and lay the foundation for consulting sales.
	Effectively position Oracle’s consulting portfolio at C-level, covering business, IT, and operations.

	Manage and close opportunities efficiently through structured sales processes.
	Drive lead generation and pipeline management activities.
	Collaborate across Oracle LOBs, FSBGU teams, and other internal and external stakeholders.
	Lead Oracle FSGU account plans and coverage models to identify and pursue target clients.
	Work with partners, alliances, license sales, and executive-level stakeholders both internally and external ly. 


Responsibilities


	Responsible for selling the Oracle consulting services. Develops new accounts and/or expands existing accounts within an established geographic territory, industry, product segment, or channel.


Key Responsibilities:
Sales Ownership & Quota Delivery:


	Own and achieve a personal quota through selling Oracle Consulting Services into assigned territories.
	Develop and execute territory and account-level sales strategies for both white space (new logos) and existing accounts.
	Manage a balanced portfolio of opportunities focused on both transformation-led deals and run-the-bank initiatives.


Customer Engagement:


	Build and nurture senior relationships across banks, regulators, fintechs, and ecosystem partners in West Africa.
	Understand customer needs and position tailored transformation proposals with clear ROI and business impact.
	Deliver strong value propositions and business cases in collaboration with presales, license sales, and delivery teams.


Sales Process & Pipeline Management:


	Create, manage, and progress a healthy pipeline of opportunities aligned with quarterly and annual sales targets.
	Lead customer engagements from opportunity creation through to closure in a structured and collaborative manner.
	Ensure accurate forecasting and deal governance per Oracle’s internal processes.

  "title": "Warehouse Coordinator",
  "description": "Promasidor - We are an African company proud of our heritage and totally committed to the continent. We manufacture, market and sell unique brands which bring practicality and pleasure to millions of consumers across Africa.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Warehouse Coordinator

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos

Objectives


	To ensure best-in-class warehouse management practices by driving efficiency in storage, product handling, and distribution, while minimising inventory losses and ensuring full compliance with established standard operating procedures.


Responsibilities


	Establish, develop, and sustain Quality Management Systems and procedures (including Good Warehouse Practices, Sanitation, Pest Control, Traceability, Storage Conditions, Internal Audits, Trainings, Risk Assessments, Housekeeping, and GMP) to ensure compliance with quality, safety, and company policies.
	Monitor and collaborate with the technical team to drive adherence to the maintenance plan, maximizing uptime and minimizing downtime of material-handling equipment.
	Oversee all warehouse transactions (stock issuance, receipts, transfers, and returns to suppliers), ensuring system and physical records are fully reconciled and properly documented.
	Develop and execute plans for monitoring warehouse usage levels, managing facilities, and reviewing storage and layout plans to ensure efficiency and quality.
	Plan, schedule, and coordinate activities relating to container receipts from ports and local suppliers, including offloading and storage.
	Provide timely feedback to Planning and Shipping Departments on container receipts through accurate documentation and prompt submission of monitoring sheets.
	Ensure daily delivery targets to production factories are achieved.
	Develop, track, and manage key performance indicators (KPIs) for warehouse operations.
	Manage inbound third-party transporter relationships to ensure efficiency and service quality.
	Oversee logistics operations and daily activities across warehouse remote locations.
	Drive optimization of warehouse operations by planning, orienting, and developing personnel capabilities through training and coaching.
	Implement strategies to optimize warehouse space utilisation and overall operational efficiency.
	Provide effective leadership, skillful direction, and conflict management to ensure smooth unit operations.
	Develop and enforce the use of daily checklists for effective management and control of equipment and tools (e.g., forklifts).
	Maintain strict adherence to inventory management principles such as FIFO (First-In, First-Out) and FEFO (First-Expiry, First-Out).
	Build agility and resilience into inventory storage systems to address exceptional situations (e.g., natural disasters, external disruptions, theft, or contamination).
	Ensure full participation in audit exercises and drive timely closure of identified audit gaps.
	Carry out assigned food safety responsibilities as directed by the Head of Department or Food Safety Team Lead.


Education &amp;&nbsp;Experience


	HND or bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Social Sciences, Engineering and Basic Sciences
	At least 7 years of work experience in warehouse, inventory, or logistics function of a reputable organisation. (FMCG).
	Membership of relevant professional bodies will be an added advantage.


Knowledge:


	Microsoft Office packages
	Supply chain management
	Logistics operations and management
	Quality management
	Service level monitoring
	Supply &amp; distribution analysis
	Inventory Management Software (NAV)
	Palletising and block stacking of raw and packaging materials.
	Capacity Optimisation
	Resources Management.
	Understanding of ISO and regulatory requirements.


Personal Attributes:


	Good communication skills
	Critical thinking and problem solving
	Good judgement
	Organizational skills
	Creative
	Analytical skills
	People management
	Customer &amp; quality service
	Strategic thinking
	Team player and Team Building attributes
	Ability to work under pressure
	Honesty and Integrity.
